text: Hello there! How can I use custom and predefined images in modules? User will no need to change them in builder. Screenshot solution doesn`t work(

hi there, is it possible to re-submit a form without refresh on HubSpot ? got the following errors :

Not submitting form because we are already submitting

you can’t upload images directly in design manager, you have to upload it into file manager and than you can use it, and it’s upto you if you have to give user option to change it or not :slightly_smiling_face:

Does the error appear on an external embedded form? And happen after form validation return failed, when you try to submit it again? Could you give us a description how to reproduce the error? Did you do something special with the form fields? How does your form look like?

Maybe you like to think about SVG, it is markup language and can be used like code, that save you the load of a additional file-request for the client. And you can put it into a partial and place it with the HubL import syntax.
For Themes you have the option to upload files into your Theme direcrory.
In modules you can create assets with _linked file > other files_ form the file-manager, like <@UNWHHSWHJ> described:
You can just create an image folder in your file directory for your theme. Then use the get_asset_url(pathName) to access it
Your very last line - after type: group — `defualt : []`  instead of `default: {}` Because its set to be a repeater group the default must be an array, even if blank. Instead of an object
